similar_project_experience.project_name: Tejon Street Concept Design - Colorado Avenue to East St. Vrain Street
similar_project_experience.project_description: Kimley-Horn provided the City with concept level civil and streetscape design services for the Tejon Street improvements. The Kimley-Horn team provided grant application assistance including providing written input using CDOT's application. Additionally, Kimley-Horn coordinated with the City and Downtown Partnership to propose typical sections, roadway plans, and utility plans to be used as a guide for the concept plan design.

similar_project_experience.project_name: 31st Street and Pikes Peak Avenue Bike and Pedestrian Traffic Signal Design
similar_project_experience.project_description: Kimley-Horn is providing environmental and design services for a bike and pedestrian traffic signal and associated pedestrian improvements at 31st Street and Pikes Peak Avenue. The team is providing final design services, which was used by the City to obtain construction funding provided by a TAP grant. This project involves CDOT clearances and the adherence to CDOT Standards and Specifications, as well as FIR/FOR processes. The scope of work includes a bike and pedestrian traffic signal, reconstruction of existing curb ramps, sidewalks, curbs, median noses, and signage and striping.

similar_project_experience.project_name: Gainesville CRA Master Plan

similar_project_experience.project_name: Savannah Historic Streetscapes
similar_project_experience.project_description: As a part of a larger downtown revitalization initiative, EDSA created a streetscape plan for the City’s most storied thoroughfares. The concept is centered on increasing pedestrian, ADA and bicycle safety as well as vehicular functionality, smart transportation design and historic preservation. Features include widened sidewalks, bike racks and lanes, medians, bioswales and street plantings.

similar_project_experience.project_name: City of La Puente

similar_project_experience.project_name: University of Florida Historic Master Plan
similar_project_experience.project_description: EDSA, university staff and the alumni association collaborated to devise a master plan that captured the historic integrity of the campus. EDSA provided master planning through construction administration.

similar_project_experience.project_name: Walton & Central Intersection
similar_project_experience.project_description: Transportation Director: The City of Bentonville approved a $173 million bond issue in spring 2021 and retained Olsson for five street and 10 stormwater drainage improvement projects, including the intersection at Walton Boulevard and Central Avenue. The project will add dual eastbound and westbound left-turn lanes and dedicated northbound and southbound right-turn bays; the project will also provide updated stormwater drainage systems. Olsson engineers will then conduct field exploration using geotechnical boring to perform laboratory tests on representative samples of soil and pavement and provide a geotechnical report based on site data. Cost: $1.9M (Construction)

similar_project_experience.project_name: 56th Street and County Line Road Improvements
similar_project_experience.project_description: Group Leader: To address the rapid population growth in Northwest Arkansas, particularly along the Interstate 49 corridor, the City of Springdale is funding infrastructure improvements. Olsson is leading the reconstruction of 56th Street and County Line Road, transforming them from two-lane roads to multi-lane urban roadways with modern amenities. This project includes widening 1.3 miles of 56th Street and 1 mile of County Line Road, adding a roundabout, and integrating pedestrian and bike paths. Olsson's comprehensive services cover geotechnical surveys, utility coordination, roadway design, and construction management, enhancing connectivity and efficiency for the community. Cost: $15.8M (Construction)

similar_project_experience.project_name: Goblin Drive Improvements
similar_project_experience.project_description: Project Manager: Goblin Drive Improvements project for approximately 1260 linear feet of Goblin Drive project includes roadway upgrades from the existing ditched roadway section to include a 3-lane roadway with curb & gutter, sidewalk, storm sewers, waterline and sanitary sewer adjustments, hydraulic analysis, bridge replacement, traffic signal, and intersection lighting. Pedestrian facilities will be constructed with a sidewalk added to the west side. Olsson was hired to provide concept layouts and typical sections of the corridor to assist the City in obtaining stakeholder buy-in of the proposed improvements including 3 roundabouts, and other roadway improvements to eliminate the existing ditches, provide curb and gutter and storm drainage and to improve and control access. Cost Phase 1: $2.6M; Cost Phase 2: $5.6M

similar_project_experience.project_name: University of Arkansas, Maple Street Cycle Track
similar_project_experience.project_description: Project Manager: This project featured the detailed design of the Maple Street cycle track from the Razorback Greenway through the Maple Street and Garland Avenue intersection. Olsson handled street reconstruction, bike and pedestrian facilities, landscaping, lighting, stormwater improvements, and utility coordination, all in line with the University of Arkansas Master Plan. The team delivered world-class bike infrastructure while preserving the area's historical integrity by using pavers and granite consistent with the university's materials palette. Cost: $11M (Construction)

similar_project_experience.project_description: Updated Denver DOTI's new Pedestrian Intersection Improvement Program using best practices from peer cities to create a prioritization process balancing needs like safety, public involvement, synergy with DOTI projects, etc. Jessica led the team in creating a Risk Assessment Tool for evaluating intersection improvements with interactive risk and cost assessments including inputs on parking, right-of-way, curb ramp and sidewalk condition, utilities, drainage, and topography.
